abstract: Tony Clark, head of major league players' union, says New York Mets pitcher Jenrry Mejia, who drew lifetime ban from MLB after testing positive for performance-enhancing drugs for third time, never voiced concerns about his legal defense.
lead_paragraph: The head of the major league players’ union said he was not aware of any concerns raised by the suspended Mets reliever Jenrry Mejia about his legal defense.
snippet: The head of the major league players’ union said he was not aware of any concerns raised by the suspended Mets reliever Jenrry Mejia about his legal defense....
